content.description: This climbs the razor sharp arete upstream from ATG. Move around to the upstream side for the start. Climb the short obvious left facing corner that leads directly to the arete, 5.9 with medium cams. Pull onto arete and cross over to the down stream side. Bolt, then a small wire in a notch In middle of traverse. A precarious mantle under the roof crack puts you onto a cool ledge. Good cams here and nasty sharp finger locks above roof with more good cams. I aided two moves but it would go free hard ten or eleven.The crack is super painful.....waaa. Follow thin cracks for ten feet to a double bolt anchor on top of tower. Cool climb with great exposure.
content.protection: Cams to 3 inches, 1 bolt and double bolt belay
content.location: Sharp Razorback arete in middle of buttress.

content.description: The scrappy right facing corner to the right of KOTSW. It is the back of the tower the previous route climbs. With a dedicated cleaning crew, half gallon of gas and a fire hose, this would be pretty classic 5.8 crack climbing. Climb the corner with a crux about half height, it becomes wider at top. Either climb over rim and a tree belay or stem onto summit of tower and use KOTSW anchors.
content.location: The upstream side of KOTSW tower.

content.description: This is the left most route and is recognized by a square cut arete leading to a small tree. Start by large tree at base, stepping left onto arete and a bolt. A small cam is available in a slot above this, then a small runout takes you to the next bolt. The crux is thin moves above the bolt to the tree, sling and a good .75 under the roof. Move right and pull the roof, good medium cam, then to double bolt anchor. This route was climbed ground up free, so the bolting was done where I could get a good foot hold,Â Not a sport climb sorry!
content.location: Look for the obvious arete with a large tree at its base.

content.description: The arete immediately right/ upstream from attack of the spider monkey. Climb an unprotected slab about 20 feet to a horizontal crack, medium cam or reach up to slab above for the first bolt. Pull onto this slab from right side and move left to arete and a good small cam or wire. Another thin crack above holds a small cam. Move up arete to a slabby ledge below a roof. Piton here and long sling recommended. Move right then up till you can clip a bolt. Harder moves past this and hard clip for second bolt, harder moves past this to double bolt belay above. Great rock and fun this moves.
content.protection: 3 bolts, 1 piton and some cams to 1 inch
